revised_title: Resonance and Non-Resonance Fluorescent Excitation of Mercury: A Study of Luminosity and Metastable Atoms
tldr: The author investigates the fluorescent excitation of mercury vapor using resonance and non-resonance frequencies. They study the distribution and behavior of the resulting luminosity and discover the presence of metastable atoms in the glowing mercury vapor. The findings provide insights into the mechanisms of fluorescence and the properties of long-lived excited atoms.
